intro: Campanula sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its spherical, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Campanula sphaerocarpa is also known for its attractive, long-lasting flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
